comments:
This course covers fundamentals of heat and mass transfer and discusses applications to problems in energy conversion and conservation. The course emphasizes a physical and analytical understanding of conductive, convective, radiative heat transfer, the design of heat exchangers, and heat transfer with phase change. Topics covered include types of heat transfer processes, steady state and transient conduction solutions, emission and absorption of radiation, and heat transfer by forced and natural convection.

Students described the material covered in the class as “interesting” and applicable to future careers.

Students thought Professor Lukes possessed “extensive knowledge” of the subject and made good efforts to ensure understanding of class material. However, many also reported that Professor Lukes relied heavily on powerpoint slides, making her lectures less helpful than recitations.

Some students felt the material in the class was “rushed,” contributing further to a heavy workload. Many deemed the amount of work to be “way too much” relative to the amount learned, and complained that the exams were “ridiculously hard.”
